climbs.name: No Guts, No Glory
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Dave Mayville, Nov. 2006

content.description:
Begin about 40 feet left of

Glory Road

, and about 15 feet left of a prominent arch. Step off a small boulder and climb an unprotected (5.7) face up to the arch. Two bolts protect interesting face climbing up to the Glory Road anchor.
A high quality finger crack (crux) leads to easier moves above.  It gets shade for most of the day.
content.protection: Standard rack, with emphasis on smaller pieces

content.description:
Enjoyable moves on smooth grey rock characterize this route with the crux coming near the top where one encounters a random, and all natural, perfect two-finger pocket. These rare pockets form on occasion and it's the odd route which features one (see

Elephant Walk

for another example). Bolted anchor/rap.

Well-protected climbing up a steep slab/face within staggering distance of your vehicle make this an obvious choice, yet it rarely sees any action. Two stars out of five.
content.location:
On the formation just left of

Coarse and Buggy

up a smooth face right of a left-arching crack system.

content.description:
On the left side of the face about 10 feet to the right of a pine tree is a vertical crack/seam.

Climb the crack/seam to the top.
content.protection: Standard gear and anchor material needed to set up a TR.
content.location: On the left side of the face about 10 feet to the right of a pine tree is a vertical crack/seam.
